chargeHist.descr: Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Leroy Sneed was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: In the amounts of:  $2,400.00 to Anthony J.; $1,900.00 to Shakya L. in 14CF395; and $362.00 to Ronald M. in 11CM3139.

Pay mandatory DNA surcharge, all court costs, fees and surcharges.
AS TO RESTITUTION/ALL FINANCIAL OBLIGATIONS ORDERED:  25% of prison funds collected by DOC to go toward restitution first and all other mandatory monetary obligations thereafter.
A payment plan to be established by DOC, probation and parole.
All unpaid monetary balances at the end of said period will convert to a civil judgment.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with any current sentence serving.

superMiscConds.notes: No contact with victims Anthony J. or Shakya L. in 14CF395.

Cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the State of Wisconsin Department of Corrections.
Pay all applicable fees of supervision. Failrue to pay shall result in a civil judgment being entered.

supervisions.notes:
Provide DNA sample.
Firearm/voting rights/civil judgment warnings given.

records.addlTxt: Per Order signed on 9/12/2014:  sentence  date to reflect July 7, 2014.
Corrected, restitution surcharges.
Order Correcting Judgment of Conviction signed and filed.  Copies to the District Attorney's Office and Dept of Corrections.
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. Timothy M. Witkowiak, Br. 22, for review.  mag
DOC request to correct JOC.
Associated with Charge #1
(2 AS TO 14CF395), (1 AS TO READ IN ON 11CM3139) FILED.
FILED.
Of Right To Seek Postconviction Relief, FILED.
Ineligible Voting Notice And Acknowledgement, FILED.
FILED.

Defendant Leroy Sneed in court with attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs.  Defendant Leroy Sneed in custody.  Michael Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

AS TO COUNT 1, State DISMISSES REPEATER ENHANCER ORALLY on the record
.
AS TO AMENDED COUNT 1, Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  PSI was NOT ordered. Case set for sentencing in Branch 22.

AS TO COUNT2:  DISMISSED AND READ IN.

Sentencing adjourned to a later date in Branch 22.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for 07-07-2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs in court, defendant Leroy Sneed not in court, in custody.  Michael Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
For reasons stated off the record, and with the agreement of all parties, Plea and Sentencing scheduled for a later date in Branch 22.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 06-12-2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Leroy Sneed in court with Steve Elmer under the student practice rule, along with and under the supervision of attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs.  Defendant Leroy Sneed in custody.  Michael Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
For reasons stated on the record, motion hearing not held on this date.  Action in this matter adjourned to Plea Hearing on a later date in Branch 22.
  Plea hearing scheduled for 05-08-2014 at 01:30 pm.
State's Response To Defendant's Motion For Severance, FILED.

Attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs in court, defendant Leroy Sneed not in court, in custody.  Michael Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
-  Defendant's Motion To Sever, FILED.
Motion Hearing and  Pre-trial conference scheduled for 03-27-2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Leroy Sneed in court with attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs.  Defendant Leroy Sneed in custody.  Michael Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:William Krumnow-MPD Officer, Christopher McAtee-Wauwatosa Police Department Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 22.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 11, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defense Counsel is requesting a Preliminary Hearing on behalf of the defendant.  Both parties do not object to an adjournment.  Attorney Opland Dobs is in trial in another court, not able to appear for today's proceedings.  Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.

Defendant Leroy Sneed in court with attorney Darryl Smith for Nathan Opland-Dobs.  Defendant Leroy Sneed in custody.  Michael Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
State files an AMENDED COMPLAINT, ADDING COUNT 2:OPERATING A MOTOR VEHICLE WITHOUT OWNER'S CONSENT, REPEATER contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 943.23(3), 939.50(3)(i), 939.62(1)(b), a Class I Felony.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a Preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 21, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with ANTHONY J.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.

Defendant Leroy Sneed in court with attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs.  Defendant Leroy Sneed in custody.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge WITKOWIAK, Branch 22.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 12, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
